pageTitle: The Alligator Rivers Region Advisory Committee - Supervising Scientist Division
title: ARRAC Membership
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {29483=ARRAC Secretariat Phone: (08) 8920 1122 Fax: (08) 8920 1199 Email: coord.ssd@environment.gov.au, 28957=The next meeting of ARRAC is scheduled for 9 September 2015., 22154=The Alligator Rivers Region Advisory Committee (ARRAC), established under the Environment Protection (Alligator Rivers Regions) Act 1978, is a stakeholder forum for information exchange and policy consultation in relation to the effects of uranium mining on the Alligator Rivers Region environment. Public disclosure of environmental performance data through ARRAC is an important means of ensuring transparency and enhancing trust between relevant stakeholder organisations, and through this, providing assurance to the broader community that the environment remains protected from uranium mining related impacts.}
textBeforeTable: ARRAC Membership Stakeholder organisations provide information reports to each ARRAC meeting to assist knowledge sharing and reduce potential for misinformation. These reports usually include a summary and interpretation of monitoring data, details of periodic environmental reports from mining companies and the outcomes of Supervising Scientist audit and assessment activity. More about the Alligator Rivers Region The Alligator Rivers Region Advisory Committee (ARRAC), established under the Environment Protection (Alligator Rivers Regions) Act 1978, is a stakeholder forum for information exchange and policy consultation in relation to the effects of uranium mining on the Alligator Rivers Region environment. Public disclosure of environmental performance data through ARRAC is an important means of ensuring transparency and enhancing trust between relevant stakeholder organisations, and through this, providing assurance to the broader community that the environment remains protected from uranium mining related impacts. The Alligator Rivers Region Advisory Committee Climate change A Cleaner Environment Water SS publications Consultation with indigenous communities
textAfterTable: Meeting frequency In general ARRAC meets twice a year. These meetings may be attended by observers. The next meeting of ARRAC is scheduled for 9 September 2015. Observers ARRAC meetings are attended by members and/or deputy members of the Committee and their respective advisors. Observers may attend meetings by invitation from the Chair, by invitation by a member with the approval of the Chair or by writing to the ARRAC Secretariat requesting to attend.
